answerText: Joseph Haydn[10] Haydn wrote works extensively for this chamber ensemble of two violins, a viola, and a cello. Mozart wrote 23 of these and Beethoven wrote one known as his Grosse Fuge.
heading: Prison Bowl |2014 | 05 | 18 | Fine Arts | Auditory | HS
subject: Fine Arts
question: Question: He published a set of chamber works entitled "Erd√∂dy" and "Sun." For 10 points each: [10] Name this Austrian composer and "Father" of a certain genre of chamber music. He wrote works in that genre including ones titled "The Joke" and "Emperor."
